Piracy Education.
0 / 10  Intro aka .. PRACTICAL IMAGINATION   

As part of the piracy and hacker communities, we have seen a lot of creative processes and transgressive strategies and tactics that could be part of higher education.

This has led to some questions;  What can piracy teach, that the higher education cannot? What if the higher education embraced piracy? As piracy rearranges the reality around us; What possibilities and desires for a greater commons and learning could that open up?

As an introduction we have a short science fiction text about the reorganization of society and how something that could by call cybernetic anarchy pirate communes are forming around open knowledge processes.						

Science fiction is a short cut to imagination. By asking “What if...” we can start to explore the implication of relation between culture, society and technology in an accessible way. I think piracy works in a mirrored way, by a kind of a  “What if...” hands on doing. What if we do like this. What if I do like that. The pirate start to  reassemble the world around her making access to culture, society and technology possible. In this way we can call piracy a type of practical imagination. 


Piracy is a knowledge and transformative process as is rearranges the reality around us and explores the relation between culture, society and technology in a way where access is a key. In practice by testing, transgress, probing to find out what is possible opening fractions, open up fractals, mixing, leaving the world as it was found in an unfinished flux. Thus piracy has no final solution but is a constantly evolving struggle. 

This type of piracy is a kind of basic resistance because it is altering the basic organizing principles of society and how we function. Logically it can be used as a weapon against the current systems of domination of state and capital. 

1 / 10 PP aka .. . / PIRACY; the user and the system.  

Today two weeks ago Aaron Swartz committed suicide. What can Aaron Swartz's death teach us about the contemporary higher educational systems as a distributor and controller of knowledge? How does the relation between the user and the system play out in this case?

The user, the individual, a person, Aaron Swartz, a american programmer, hacker, organizer and activist. He was a Pirate and he highly valued access to information and knowledge. That is why he downloaded Millions Jstor academic MIT pdfs with the intent to share them.

The system, MIT and a the MIT network including Jstor. MIT is an institution that has a long tradition of a special kind of freedom. MIT was one of the places where the first generation of hacker gathered and spawned. It was where Richard Stallman came up with the concept of free software, trying to liberate the user from preparatory software systems. MIT also has long tradition of openness and making higher education more accessible, like the free online course of Opencourseware.  

As we can read in the Aarons family's official statement we need to take part in forming the future of education in a tradition of freedom, access and openness and ...

.... failing to choose sides may prove fatal to the future of both higher education and all other public services. At stake is the definition of what constitutes the political and what is subject to public debate, of what is withdrawn from scrutiny under the cloak of property rights or the laws of economy.

From Aarons family’s official statement.



This would mean that safely and steadily turn away from certain modern management and control structures and the current use of copyright as it helps in building a climate of fear as it is stressing that we need to insure the control of knowledge production. It it is neither the case that we have anything to fear from piracy and the control of it in this manner is certainly not the way forward if we are to build a sustainable higher education system of the future. A system that should be able to meet a constant global change and at the same time keep up with making an education with local relevance. 

The contemporary liberal system that regulates these processes are based on the notion of individual copyrights and is causing fear, feeding domination of management that are growing obsolete with expanding networks, absolutely abstract. Real darkness disguised in vanilla, a veil over the every day. Aaron's case is an illustration of the constant miscommunication, where we are consequently dealing with a system that both what us to be in the center and step aside. This is a common contradiction of knowledge society that we need to break. 

How could we trace this fear? One line of thinking we find in the thinking of the big three in greek philosophy and how they looked at knowledge. It was formulated as an existential question by Socrates. When we ask what we can know we end up at the problem of the unknown. Socrates pointed out an insecurity in knowledge that  we cannot know everything. In a political realm this insecurity makes control harder and are turned into a political fear when we ask; How can one rule the world without a solid ground? 

At this point the sophist try to provide easy answers to the unsolvable questions and here by secure the contract between the citizen and the political. Or as Plato's try to answer this question with the abstract world, to insure knowledges solidity adding a hierarchical solution of knowledge but also a layer of management and leadership to understand these abstractions. We can know but knowledge need to be mediated top down, by experts, politicians and philosophers. Instantiating a level of management of insecurity, institutions of fear. 

Here we are defining a the citizen as a bystander, that in the everyday see the defaulting in the street. Introduce the unknown as a blackbox, a territory of the political realm, fear distant but insurance, turned into fear of the insured blackbox, representational democracy is its restless - Wow.

Retaking the power is what Aristotle's pointed to, the empirical, the street, praxis, matter, the real, button up, that we can learn by looking at the world as it is. What we need is a knowledge that accepts our fear for the unknown but takes more control of the everyday away from hierarchical domination of knowledge. Let’s accept that insecurity and make the unknown a guidance of a piracy imaginary. 


2 / 10 PP aka ... / ANARCHY from individuation to subjectivation 

We live in a networked society, what we learn we could never have learned without the internet, we are from the internets and so are our fear and desires, we know how to organize, we know how to build systems, we know how to get knowledge. But can the institutions of higher education make room for a piracy imaginary?

Can we help dismantle the destructive powers of top-down management, break down barriers and empower these learning processes that are flowing to a larger degree, ad hoc, outside institutional control?

If we want brilliance, the unknown and difference, if we want to facilitate the process of sometimes autodidactic and restless pirates, hackers and random users the old management style of top down planning does not cut it.

In software development this is understood. Agile methods such as scrum, with small self managed teams, are a way to give power to the developer to make development more efficient. Individual responsibility and feedback are key in these systems. This also point to a general tendency in society where we all should learn entrepreneurial skills and become self-sustained. 

In hierarchical command and control structures, be it the state or big business, if resource become limited the inefficacy of the flow of information and things will break down under its own cost. One solution of this  is to push down and out the initiative and labor into the network. If they still can keep the power they have succeeded. But as they let go they will start to change the structure to a point where individuation point to a possibility to get rid of the control structure and self-organize.  

This problem of scale and power makes our current development of society full of conflicts between centralizing and decentralizing powers. Decentralisation a way to cut organisational costs means that a representative hollow management must be put in place upstreams, self-management, pushed down the chain. Suddenly working means to be part of a reports system, report society. All the power in hand by no control. 

So what should be done differently? Can we fit in these systems or do we have to build our own? Is higher education becoming a middleman?  If the scope of state schools are to make us good capitalist workers, isn't that very insecure for us in a society where work is getting harder to get?  Isn't a kind of self-organized anarchy education what we need? If so,  can we abandon or withdraw from the state controlled market driven system? Can we break and bypass these organization build on estrangeing property control?

If we imagine that we could bypass the educational system, would that mean that education would become a personal endeavor and concern? Maybe not. 

Silvia Federici point to Negri and Hardt as they say that “the common” is already evolving from the informatization and cognitivization of production.

 “According to this theory, as production presumably becomes production of knowledge, culture, and subjectivity, organized through the internet, a common space and common wealth are created that escape the problem of defining rules of inclusion or exclusion. For access and use multiply the resources available on the net, rather than subtracting from them, thus signifying the possibility of a society built on abundance – the only remaining hurdle confronting the “multitude” being how to prevent the capitalist “capture” of the wealth produced.”   

Now thanks to a common forming within the current capitalist society, we can escape the dilemma of the private matter, by start adding to a commons. 

So we arrive at a collaborative forms of learning and production that goes hand in hand with shared access to common resources and also the question. What models can we point to,  to guide this reorganisation. 

1 As an abstract model to to change the current hierarchical systems of economic and political organization/domination we can use the free and open source software development as the model for sharing. We need to continue make society into a transparent open source project. 

2 As a concrete model we can use decentralized network to mediate these processes: If any group of centralizing nodes produces scarcity through democratic or authoritarian means distributed networks can turn hierarchical control into networked a diversity.  But how do we keep it alive and how do we keep the infrastructure open? 

What kind of mutual aid and piracy roles are needed? Can we start to think from Richard Bartles idea of player types in game worlds as a way to map a world of the commons, a piracy as abstract territory with exteriority and internalities? How would the internation look like?

Internation - different kind of pirates, a first draft ->	
           



















What is missing and how can this grafh be improved?      

Developers: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rRm0NDo1CiY

3 / 10 aka ... / EMPOWERMENT - zombies ahead. 

Teaching ‘piracy’ or ‘piratically’ or for “piracy” means teaching relations and methods at the same time. It means teaching a socially engaged empowerment. 

To give way for independent and free roaming minds one might start in hacker ethics; anything that can teach you something about the way the world work should be made accessible and free. A teaching by learning, teaching by doing, hands on and in our case at the same time teaching by rebuilding and for reorganizing. The empowerment is for you and also for others, with the goal to build trust that is key for the continuation of learning. 

When we think about empowerment in this context we must extend the empowerment to build trust networks within the commons. That is we need a heads up, because within the emerging commons there will be zombies! To name some of the the ego, matter and conspiracy zombie. 

Look out for the ego zombie. That zombie constantly drains the commons, converting empowerment to an individual matter. Empty charades, a empty logo, a - Just do it, a pure capitalist force, for innovators without a common cause, an entrepreneurial force that just wants to make it happen. One antidote by teaching could be to empower the mind beyond the ego and to understand that ego is just a tendency and not an essence that will open up a contextualization of a commons. 

When we draw from practical based teaching like craft and art teaching, starting in matter and the personal we should also look out for the matter zombie, feeding on reductive imaginary of  “fabrics and facts”, superimposing images of matter as cause. This is not a playful type but feeds on conserving social relations by referring to the state of things, like of instance imposing nature on culture by say nature is natural, reversing existence to essens. One antidote by teaching could be to empower by learning to break stereotypes. 

We should also add the conspiracy zombie, that make the global models an obsession in a way that the paranoia - - are swapped way from local concrete engagement. One antidote by teaching could be concrete projects.  

We should look for these zombies within our own processes. We could also talk about zombifying matter in the fabric of the everyday. Or to put it in another way, how abstractions of capital and state plays out as abstracting possible relations and the way the concrete possibilities becomes abstracted in capitalism or anti-bazaars. A consolidation, stiff an uncanny matter that can be seen in opposition how the digital and the common are converging into a plan of possibilities.  

[ Or is this just Madness, play video? ] 0 - 1:00

Drawing from the earlier discussion about anarchy, one could think about how we can weigh between structure and freedom of learning, weigh the collective structures and individual freedom of learners. What would a system like this look like? What would a cybernetic techno-anarchy education look like? 

Empowerment needs and requires structure, self-organisation and reorganisation instead of revolution or destabilisation. Basically because the revolution is here and we just need to find a way to make it, enforce it with every demanding of equality. But how can we find the way to institutionalize equality and its regeneration without putting too much force into hands of individuals or make a structure that are more than what we gain. With what kind of math can we break the tokens of power?
 
Once again we will turn to a piracy imaginary and say that sharing can break the token of power.  What we need to do is to build institution with sharing where we learn to weigh sharing as structure and as force. Empowerment need to be structured in time and locally. As an example the hackerspace both transgress the tyranny of structurelessness in time and at the same time accept that self-organisation is more than us and that structurelessness are somehow needed to be successful in terms of community. By sharing our knowledge in meatspace we both start a process weighing for instance we engage in a of a unification process other but we can also be aware of the danger of consolidation of the group. In space we are able organize beyond preconceptions and recognize other people's efforts and so on. 

We need to learn to weigh the insecurity together, incorporate insecurity, the is actually not other way than to make things transparent, mediated and accessible. What we are asking is how we can form a type of education but as we see in the context of cognitive capitalism we are questioning the sustainability of the current state-capital apparatus because we are inclosed in that system. 

4 / 10 aka ... / COGNITIVE CAPITALISM - incorporate insecurity
Cognitive capitalism it is the current mode of global networked production that we can not really escape. Not only software designers, students, teachers, artists, intellectuals but increasingly all. Our teaching systems are the backbone and the frontend of this systems.

Cognitive capitalism means that our creativeness, our ability to be creative is the basis for our work. Basically this is communication put into different forms of labour. This can be an enriching experience, but what if something so personal loses its voluntary character and become an economic necessity and a disconnected joyless construction. Still paradoxically looked in and connected at the same time. 

Cognitive capitalism is also the landscape in which pirate teachers could evolve. To mediate, intervene and change these processes are becoming ever more pressing sense we can not escape this system.

What if pirates have the best cognitive capitalist potential but won't serve capitalism and have a lot of surplus time and money from the capitalist system. What could we build to mediate local resistance, or help mediate people's opinions and knowledge seeking. Against top down management, how can we bypass the relation between creativity and production, property and law? Maybe by start open schools, maybe by building alternative to lock in systems, like spotify and facebook to re-insure a diversity. Rebuild the world around us, being socially engaged pirates. 

There is a relation between hacking and piracy and sometime it doesn't matter what you call it. In other circumstances they could be called innovator but  the word innovator abstracts the real conflicts of information, access and equality. Hackers need access, the pirate provides it, if you are a pirate you have to learn the systems and you will become a hacker, if you are a hacker you have to become a pirate as you transgress, obstructing property laws. And it might happen that if try to stop piracy you might get hacked, if you try to stop hacking well thats not possible because it brings some much value to society and would mean that you put a lid on the world. There is no time for that. Innovator!

We can relate work and learning to the fear of everyday insecurity. In learning played out as being force to accept predefined goals. Learning goals based on the the insecure job-market. We need to accept something more undefined . We need to convert that insecurity to a force of our own, by building internal control and sensibility instead of accepting externally forced insecurity. 

5 / 10 PP aka ... / HACKING -> RESEARCHING SPACE

As a concrete way we should use hacking as a research method. the English word “pirate” comes via Latin from Greek and means “one who attempts”. How can we encourage this attitude in term of education and production of knowledge? According to anarchist pedagogues, knowledge production is achieved by doing and that can be a way to dismantle the dichotomy between intellectual workers and craftmen/women (colonial, postcolonial contexts), and understand the process of knowledge as something that must oscillate between different kind of modes and speeds. As process where we need to get back to the problem at hand after being away, find different attack vectors to the same problem and so on. What will be produced is a tool box what is at stake to be change is a key to understand the work and division of work as a domestication process that we have to take control over. Free time for the spirit of learning.  

This will lead us to ask How do one manage/organise/create and run a teaching transmission space and process if knowledges should be structured without bureaucracy and administration. Is not bureaucracy related to division of labor. We need to reorganise society so all have time to learn. That is why this reorganisation is a kind of revolution, we need to brake the property loop consumer loop that keep filling our time. 

We can investigate how to get a away from image of thought, ask what does it mean to be human. 

Learners should never be afraid of teachers or the environment they are in, that way we should all see our self as teacher and learners to try to create a safe learning environment in that sense that we break stereotypes, seek freedom way from fear, deconstruct the persona of domination.

If it won’t be about result, it will be about process and attitude, how do one deal with this paradox? I think we can solve this problem by pointing to the unfinished, that the knowledge we produce always are a tendencies rather than the full answer. Even if we find clear answers to many questions the context of these question will always demand a contextualization, that led to a position where we step out of the boundaries of that original clearcut scenario. We need to value and weight the impact of the unknown, in some endeavors this will be a clear. In this case what we need to look out for where the results become a burden over processes, via power relation between student and teacher, learners and institutions. As hacker ethic say: Information and anything that can teach you something about the way the world works should be open and free. I think our mission should be to open, make and hack the systems. The systems is already out there filled with rules, laws and structures of power. It should be our concern to bend and break the rules of the everyday. Rearrange these systems and make them hackable or build new ones. A constant iteration. So in a room that accept all this, is that what we need to create?

[ Long Cat] all

6 / 10 aka ... /  SUBVERSION -> PERVERSION > ITERATION

We should accept that there already is a learning environment out there, with internet as a backbone. If you are a pirate, you are educated because you have tried things, hacked things. You have learned alone and with others who also are learners. If you are a pirate you constantly need access to things in order to share them. If you are a pirate that also means you are an a kind of anarchist in hart, not supportive of property, a property that implies abstract laws and regulation of your learning process. 

Do you have to know or master the law to subvert it or do you learn the law be subverting it? 

One way to fight hegemony that digital networks good at is by subversion. It is an attempt to transform the established social order and its structures of power, authority, and hierarchy by iterating them.
